info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 6 at 8:27AM CDT until April 6 at 9:45AM CDT by NWS Birmingham AL
info.description:
* WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of central Alabama, including the following county, Tuscaloosa.
* WHEN...Until 945 AM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 827 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 2.5 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Tuscaloosa, Northport, Holt, University Mall, McFarland Mall, Bryant Denny Stadium, Tuscaloosa Amphitheater, Shelton State Community College, Tuscaloosa Regional Airport, University Of Alabama Quad, Taylorville, Stillman College, Oliver Lock And Dam, Lake Tuscaloosa Dam, Cottondale, Palmore Park, Englewood, Lake Harris, Holt Lock And Dam and Little Sandy.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 AM CDT THIS MORNING... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING
